data.text: @C_Kavanagh @lasym21 Also, there is a lableak conspiracy theory: COVID-19 was created as a bioweapon and was released on purpose. This lableak conspiracy theory is ludicrous yet prominent proponents of wetmarket theory conflate lableak theory with lableak conspiracy theory to discredit  lableak.

@C_Kavanagh @lasym21 I understand that some people like to class coverups as conspiracy, yet I’ve checked the dictionary, so you can try your best, but a conspiracy theory involves describing a conspiracy aka a plot. Let’s not move the goalposts.

@C_Kavanagh @lasym21 Comparing either 911-truth or the “moon landing faked” with lableak neatly illustrates why lableak isn’t a conspiracy theory; the 911 truthers believe the gov planned that heinous act yet the credible lableak theory is that the COVID-19 epidemic started by unplanned lab accident.
@C_Kavanagh @lasym21 Pretty soon you’ll have “I deleted my account bc I’m f**cked-itis”

@C_Kavanagh @su3su2u1 there is nothing defensive about my posture. the pandemic's origins are unknown and it's an interesting question. your stance on the issue is undiluted ideological reflexivity, which makes the pretense to an epistemic high ground exactly backwards.

maybe head back to rogan world
@EntropyChase @MinnNighthawks @hanumanpye @C_Kavanagh Exactly. This guy is all "let's wait and see" meanwhile the wet market BS spread like wildfire unchecked by dolts like him
@C_Kavanagh @lasym21 Look at that strawman come out to play

@lasym21 @su3su2u1 It is very funny to hear this given how often you appear extremely defensive of any criticism of even the most myopic lab leak advocates. If it’s just about the evidence then this is a non-issue as the weight of evidence has not been swinging wildly.
